title: Covid-19: Three Essex survivors recount their experiences
description: Three people who survived coronavirus share their stories, from hospital to recovery.

title: China is 'trampling on Hong Kong's democracy'
description: With Beijing's influence now paramount, many in Hong Kong are torn between defiance and resignation.

title: Mozambique Palma attack: How people tried to flee the assault
description: Survivors and their family members recount what happened when Islamist militants targeted Palma.

title: 'We found a baby on the subway - now he's our son'
description: Danny Stewart saw something on the floor of an NY subway station - soon he would treasure it more than anything.

title: Boat Race 2021: Universities move from London to Ely
description: The traditional showdown between Oxford and Cambridge universities takes place on the Great Ouse this year.

title: Hidden treasure: Hertford Union Canal gives up its secrets
description: Anna Borzello explores the Hertford Union Canal as it is drained for the first time in 20 years.

title: Long lost pen pals reunited after 70 years
description: Jim Johnston from Belfast tracked down his American pen pal seven decades after losing touch.

title: How Princess Diana has been portrayed on stage and in film
description: A new Broadway musical about the princess is just the latest in a series of portrayals of her life.

title: Project 17: Solving Singapore's food waste problem
description: Shan, 17, wants to find out just how much food gets wasted in his home country of Singapore.

title: Marwa Elselehdar: 'I was blamed for blocking the Suez Canal'
description: Egypt's pioneering ship captain has been targeted over false rumours about her role in the incident.

title: Emma Caldwell suspect 'attacked woman in same woods'
description: A woman claims she was attacked by a man identified as a prime suspect in the murder of Emma Caldwell.

title: Carl Frampton retires after losing to Jamel Herring in WBO world title fight
description: Carl Frampton announces his retirement after being stopped by Jamel Herring in the sixth round of their WBO super-featherweight contest.

title: Egypt mummies pass through Cairo in ancient rulers' parade
description: The Cairo spectacle sees the remains of 18 kings and four queens taken to a new resting place.

title: Bridgerton fans mourn Regé-Jean Page's exit
description: Kim Kardashian joins those lamenting the news about the second series of the popular Netflix show.

title: Wally the Walrus: Fears for safety as Tenby tourists get 'too close'
description: Conservationists urge Tenby tourists to enjoy the stray mammal's temporary visit "from a distance".

title: Rowley Regis dog attack: Woman, 85, killed by dogs that got through fence hole
description: The 85-year-old woman suffered a "sustained" attack in the "horrific" incident, police say.

title: Covid: Clean-up after crowds party in Cardiff Bay despite restrictions
description: People "intent" on breaking Covid-19 rules left a "significant" amount of rubbish, says council.

title: Covid-19: Seven UK blood clot deaths after AstraZeneca vaccine
description: The regulator confirms the deaths to the BBC, but says the benefits continue to outweigh any risk.

title: ICYMI: Volcano volleyball and cool cats
description: Cherry blossom, animal Easter egg hunts and some of the other stories you may have missed.

title: Police uncover teenage girl ‘suicide’ Instagram group
description: Twelve UK girls, aged between 12 and 16, were part of a chat group that led to "serious self-harm".

title: Race report: Was controversy part of the plan?
description: How the government handled the release of a contentious report on racial disparity in the UK.

title: Free climber George King scales skyscraper hotel in Barcelona without permission
description: George King, 21, was met by police after climbing a skyscraper hotel without safety equipment.

title: Extreme-E: 'Hero' drive and spectacular crashes in qualifying
description: Watch highlights from first qualifying in round one of Extreme-E from Al-Ula, Saudi Arabia including a driver finishing with a puncture and two big crashes.

title: Covid-19: Care home residents in England allowed two visitors from 12 April
description: From 12 April, two people - as well as babies and young children - will be allowed for indoor visits.

title: Richard Okorogheye: Police appeal to missing student to 'get in touch'
description: A search of Epping Forest, near where Richard Okorogheye was last seen, enters a third day.

title: Esports body calls for disability gaming tournaments
description: Disabled players took part in an esports tournament, now there are calls for specific competitions.

title: Covid-19: Italy returns to strict lockdown for Easter
description: The measures come as Italy battles a third wave of the pandemic, with more than 20,000 new cases daily.

title: 'We just got destroyed' - Warriors blown away in record Raptors win
description: The Toronto Raptors record the biggest win in their history in a rout of the Golden State Warriors.

title: US Capitol: Police officer dies after car rams security barrier
description: The driver of the vehicle was shot dead by police after lunging at officers with a knife.

title: ‘The comeback to end all comebacks’ - Cleall set for England Six Nations return
description: The Women's Six Nations finally returns on Saturday two months later than planned, but for England prop Bryony Cleall the wait has been significantly longer.

title: The Papers: Staycation 'stampede' and NHS future blueprint
description: Covid's impact on holidays and the health service are two dominant stories on Saturday's front pages.

title: Writing songs in lockdown: 'It was an escape'
description: Musicians amateur and professional have joined in a BBC-led project to document lockdown songs.
